I agree, this is really the only approach you should consider.  Tests
shouldn't have side effects.  If you find yourself doing the same thing
in many tests (like inserting 'RecordIWillLookForInAMoment'), move that
to a helper method.

The thing that I decided that really cleaned things up for me is that
within a unit test, its ok if the helper methods *also* contain tests.

More clearly, its bad if a testXXX method has some side effect, but if
a helper method doSomeAction has a 'side effect' of testing some
conditions, that's not a bad thing.

$.02

Kevin
> If writing the suite method yourself doesn't sound like a good
> option,
> you could just move this into one testXXX() and do the two inserts
> and check in the test that the second fails, then clean up the
> inserted record in tearDown().
